titleStmt.title: The true lovers knot untied, being the right path whereby to advise princely vergins how to behave themselves, by the example of the renowned princess, the Lady Arabella, and the second son of the Lord Seymore, late Earl of Hartfort. To the tune of, Frog's galliard, &c. Licensed and entered according to order.

The true lovers knot untied, being the right path whereby to advise princely vergins how to behave themselves, by the example of the renowned princess, the Lady Arabella, and the second son of the Lord Seymore, late Earl of Hartfort. To the tune of, Frog's galliard, &c. Licensed and entered according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by and for A.M. and sold by the booksellers of London.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "As I to Ireland did pass ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
